Text.Text: Visitors at the gate.  Interesting.  You came from the Ten-Towns, yes?
It is as I suspected.  I am Malavon, Patron of House Despana and Archmage of[ree-LAU-venz] Rilauven's[sor-SEAR] Sorcere Academy of Magic.  I have something you need, and you have something I need.
Please, enter my camp and accept my hospitality.  Neither my allies nor I will harm you.
That was a rhetorical question.  I know that you have come from[TAR-gohs] Targos.  You are trying to reach the Severed Hand.  Enter my camp.  We can discuss matters of mutual benefit.
I agree.  It is not my concern because I am already aware of the matter's truth.  You seek passage through these caves.  Enter my camp and we can discuss matters of mutual benefit.

Amusing, but in the future, do not condescend in such a manner.  The mark of[draow, not droh] drow nobility may not weigh as heavily in[ree-LAU-ven] Rilauven as other societies, but it is still a point of pride.
Please, enter my camp.  There are things we must discuss, matters of benefit to both our parties.

When I hear such bigoted remarks from a member of a supposedly noble race, I must stand in awe.  But, we worship[vay-RAUN] Vhaeraun in[ree-LAU-ven] Rilauven.  We tolerate just about anyone if it is to our advantage.
But, enough talk of racism and theology.  Come, enter my camp.  There are matters I would discuss with you, matters of value to both you and me.
Just one moment...[SARG-tlin, MAH-glas lil ob-SOO-lahs] sargtlin, maglas lil obsulas!
Ha, ha, ha!  You must have power over the words.  Do not let the words take power over you.  A promise is not truth.  You must discern my intent through more reliable means.
Do not be obstinate.  I know that you seek a route to[KUL-duh-har] Kuldahar.  There is no way around our compound.  Let our meeting be consonant.
Well, then, your journey is going to be truncated dramatically.  Do not approach the gates or our forces will annihilate you.[AH-loo-vay] Aluve.
Stop, please.   I have grown so tired of hearing theological rhetoric.  You can discuss your differences of opinion with[KAH-dresh] Kadresh and[VEE-zrah] Viizra later.  Please, enter.

Thank you for accepting our hospitality.  As I previously stated, I am[MAH-lah-vahn deh-SPAH-nah] Malavon Despana.  This man is[KAH-dresh] Kadresh[oh-LOHN-ray] Olonrae, a respected member of the church of[vay-RAUN] Vhaeraun.

Thank you for accepting our hospitality.  I am[MAH-lah-vahn] Malavon, Patron of House[deh-SPAH-nah] Despana and Archmage of[ree-LAU-venz] Rilauven's[sor-SEAR] Sorcere Academy of Magic.  This man is[KAH-dresh] Kadresh[oh-LOHN-ray] Olonrae, a respected member of the church of[vay-RAUN] Vhaeraun.
We are assisted by[VEE-zrah] Viizra[air-uh-BAH-nee] Arabani, formerly of the church of[LAWLTH] Lolth, now a faithful member of[ree-LAU-venz] Rilauven's church of[vay-RAUN] Vhaeraun.
Now that introductions are all out of the way, let me tell you of our plight.

It is not surprising to me that you have heard such things.  You probably also heard that he was a raving maniac who sold his sister into[KON-kew-beyen-aj] concubinage, yes?  Let me tell you what happened in my own words...
An interesting story, no?  The unfortunate consequences of that ruse are all too apparent now.  Please allow me to illuminate the relevance of your current situation to my own.

Several decades ago,[ree-LAU-ven] Rilauven was engaged in a civil war.  The ruling matriarchal theocracy of[LAWLTH] Lolth was overthrown by rebels working with the relatively egalitarian church of[vay-RAUN] Vhaeraun.

I was part of the group that overthrew the church of[LAWLTH] Lolth.  I managed to turn most of the wizards of[sor-SEAR] Sorcere against the matriarchy.  The Masked Traitors working against their own houses, like[VEE-zrah] Viizra, insured our victory.
Have you finished your barrage of invectives yet?
I destroyed an entire city of blind zealots just like you.  I suppose I can find room for your skull in their mass grave.

The civil war weakened us for over a decade.  When we chose to expand our influence in the Underdark, we encountered packs of[DRAI-durz] driders that the previous rulers of[ree-LAU-ven] Rilauven had created without regard for the consequences.

There were dozens of the miserable creatures spread throughout the lower regions of Dorn's Deep.  To my dismay, I discovered that my sister,[GEE-nah-fay] Ginafae, was among them.  I thought she had died years ago, before the revolt.

The driders were not content to live off of our scraps in Dorn's Deep.  We cannot rightly blame them, as they only exist in their horrible state due to the curse of[LAWLTH] Lolth.  Now, however, they have turned against us in force.

The[DRAI-durz] driders, led by my sister,[GEE-nah-fay] Ginafae, have chosen to ally themselves with the Legion of the[kai-MEHR-ah] Chimera in the Severed Hand.  They have placed themselves in strategic locations throughout the Underdark to prevent our passage.  Yours, too, I imagine.

We believe that the Legion of the Chimera has promised the driders a magical process by which they may create more of their kind.  Normally, such a transformation requires the intercession of a Handmaiden of[LAWLTH] Lolth.
Calm yourself,[VEE-zrah] Viizra.  You are no longer a member of the church of[LAWLTH] Lolth.  You need not shout curses and crack a whip every time someone swats at a spider's spinnings.

True, true.  But, back to the matter at hand, we need your assistance.  This compound is one of the only safe havens we have left near the surface.  We dare not leave lest the[DRAI-durz] driders take over this location as well.

Yes.  The[DRAI-durz] driders are in a series of caves to the east.  We believe that is also the location of whatever is transforming our captured allies into[DRAI-durz] driders.  I have attempted to divine what wizard is behind this, but he or she is magically shielded.

Do not fret.[NIHM]  Nym could trick a priest into buying his own soul.  Manipulating a band of adventurers is hardly a challenge for him.  The[DRAI-durz] driders are a hazard to his livelihood as well as ours.

When you find and destroy whatever is turning the[draow, not droh] drow into[DRAI-durz] driders, the[DRAI-durz] driders should lose their interest in harassing us.  Also, if you happen to see my sister... please, try to convince her to return here, to the camp.
You might as well clear out[DRAI-durz] driders.  Your way out of here lies through the[zah-HIN-dah] Z'hinda Citadel.  It used to be under our control, but mind flayers occupy it presently.

I am the Master of[sor-SEAR] Sorcere.  I can be sentimental if I want,[KAH-dresh] Kadresh.  Now, if you need any assistance in the form of healing, speak with[VEE-zrah] Viizra or[KAH-dresh] Kadresh.  If you are in dire need of magical supplies, I have some items you may be interested in.

No.  The only way the portals to the[zah-HIN-dah] Z'hinda Citadel open is from the inside.  The mind flayer thralls will only open the portals if one of the mind flayers is attacked.  You will not find a mind flayer there until the[DRAI-durz] driders are defeated.
I... just... know.
Greetings again.  With what can I help you?
Proceed.
Ha, ha, ha![SAH-blic TAHN]  Saablic Tan.  I should have guessed that simple-minded fool would have squirmed his way out of the fate in which my clone left him.

Decades ago, a clone I created of myself worked with a man named[SAH-blic TAHN] Saablic Tan.  Tan was a Red Wizard of[unvoiced "TH" THAY] Thay, obsessed with perverting creatures with his transmutation magic.  He worked with the demon[BEL- hee -fet] Belhifet because it allowed him opportunities for experimentation.

The clone I sent to work for[BEL- hee -fet] Belhifet worked under[SAH-blic] Saablic... that is, he did until the clone started going berserk.  For one reason or another, my clone transformed[SAH-blic] Saablic into an umber hulk and cast him out of Lower Dorn's Deep.
How he escaped from his fate and wound up creating this[vih-kihs-KAM-er-ah] "Viciscamera," I do not know.
Find and destroy this device.  If it is transforming[draow, not droh] drow into[DRAI-durz] driders, it offers the[DRAI-durz] driders potentially limitless reinforcements.
Destroy it as soon as possible.  If it is transforming[draow, not droh] drow into[DRAI-durz] driders, it offers the[DRAI-durz] driders potentially limitless reinforcements.

Excellent.  The[DRAI-durz] driders are unlikely to give us any persistent trouble.  Also, I suspect that you may find a mind flayer outside of the[zah-HIN-dah] Z'hinda Citadel now.  If you harass it, the thralls inside should open the portals to come to its defense.  An exit to the Spine of the World sits on the other side.
Indeed,[GEE-nah-fay] Ginafae did return to the camp.  You have my thanks.  I am certain she would like to thank you herself.  Wouldn't you, dear sister?

Now that our business here has concluded, we have matters to attend to in[ree-LAU-venz] Rilauven.  Thank you for your assistance, but please, do not assume that a welcoming committee will await you if you come knocking on the doors of[sor-SEAR] Sorcere.
That is unfortunate, but understandable.  She must have led a horrid life for the past three decades.  Whatever sentence you meted out on her could not have been worse than continued existence.

This cavern is quite large.  Underdark merchants frequently gather in the south after rising up from the huge canyon that lies beyond.  There are steam pools to the southeast.  Every once in a while, you may find a mind flayer and its thralls there.
[sarcasm]Thank you for sharing that fascinating revelation.[serious]  Now, please return to the caves and accomplish something.  Do not waste any more of my time.  Thank you.

Underdark merchants often have a bizarre variety of items for sale.  If your tastes are not particular, they may have something of use to you.  Be careful, though.  They will kill you if they think there is profit in it.

Mind flayers are extremely intelligent, powerful creatures.  They hover near the steam pool because they loathe dry climates.  Recently, several of them took control of the[zah-HIN-dah] Z'hinda Citadel to the northeast.

They think little of humanoid life.  To understand the significance of that statement, consider the fact that my people, the[draow, not droh] drow, are not known for their mercy or pity.  To the mind flayers, we are cattle to be fed upon.
That is unfortunate, but understandable.
Yes, we did.
No, we are not from the Ten-Towns.
It is none of your concern, dark elf.
Indeed we did, brother.
Why should we tell you, drow scum?
Ye be drow.  I'll not be telling your black ears a thing.
Your people enslave mine, dark elf.  Why should I tell a butcher like you anything?
Very well.
Do you *promise* not to harm us?
We refuse.
Very well.
Do you *promise* not to harm us?
We refuse.
Very well.
Do you *promise* not to harm us?
We refuse.
Very well.
Do you *promise* not to harm us?
We refuse.
Very well.
Do you *promise* not to harm us?
We refuse.
Vhaeraun is little better than Lolth.  A god of thieves to replace a goddess of civil war?  What foolishness.  We shall not enter.
Vhaeraun is little better than Lolth.  A god of thieves to replace a goddess of civil war?  What foolishness.  We shall not enter.
Very well, we will enter your camp.
If you will not give us your word, we will not enter.
Very well, we will enter your camp.
I will not say it again.  We will not enter your camp.
Very well, we will enter your camp.
I will not say it again.  We will not enter your camp.
Very well.
Wait - Malavon Despana?  I heard that he was killed in the raids on Dorn's Deep three decades ago.
One moment... I'll record your tale in my journal.
Very well.
Continue.
What does this have to do with the current situation?
You treacherous scum!  How dare you turn from the mother of our race?!
Enough!  That you openly talk to a drow woman as though you were her equal is insult enough, but the fact that you admit to this traitorous action is worthy of nothing less than death!
I ought to kill you for your insolence, but... continue.
Yes, I'm finished.  Die!
How many driders were there?
Get to the point, please.
Continue.
How do you mean?
Why did the driders form this alliance?
So, you want us to clear out the driders?
Now I understand why Nym wanted us to come through here...
So, you want us to clear out the driders?
That's unfortunate, Malavon, but it's your problem, not ours.
How will we know when we have taken care of the problem?
That's unfortunate, Malavon, but it's your problem, not ours.
So, you want us to clear out the driders?
Very well.  We'll simply use that exit.
Let me see what magical items you have for sale.
What can you tell me about this area?
Farewell, Malavon.
How do you know?
Divination, then?  But I suppose I should have expected such of the Archmage of a magical academy...
We asked Ginafae to return, but it seems she hasn't yet.  She seemed wary of your men.
We found Ginafae, Malavon.  Unfortunately, we had to destroy her.
We wanted to tell you about the progress we have made with the driders.
What can you tell me about this area?
Let me see what magical items you have for sale.
Nothing right now.  Farewell, Malavon.
We met a woman in the central section of the caves.  She has a laboratory there.  Apparently, she and a man named Saablic Tan created something called the Viciscamera.  It changes drow into driders.

We met a woman in the central section of the caves.  She has a laboratory there.  Apparently, she and a man named Saablic Tan created something called the Viciscamera.  It changes drow into driders.  We defeated her.
We found an object that changes drow into driders, but we haven't destroyed it yet.
We found an object called the Viciscamera that changes drow into driders.  We haven't destroyed it yet.
We found an object that changes drow into driders.  We destroyed it.
We found an object that changes drow into driders.  We destroyed it.  A berserk wizard came rushing to its defense, but we defeated her.
We haven't discovered anything yet.
What do you mean?
What should we do now?
We destroyed the Viciscamera, so the drider threat should be resolved.
We asked Ginafae to return, but it seems she hasn't yet.  She seemed wary of your men.
We found Ginafae, Malavon.  Unfortunately, we had to destroy her.
What can you tell me about this area?
Let me see what magical items you have for sale.
Farewell, Malavon.
We asked Ginafae to return, but it seems she hasn't yet.  She seemed wary of your men.
We found Ginafae, Malavon.  Unfortunately, we had to destroy her.
What can you tell me about this area?
Let me see what magical items you have for sale.
Farewell, Malavon.
Did Ginafae ever return to the camp?
We found Ginafae, Malavon.  Unfortunately, we had to destroy her.
Very well.
Very well.
Farewell, Malavon.
We wanted to tell you about the progress we have made with the driders.
What can you tell me about this area?
Let me see what magical items you have for sale.
Farewell, Malavon.
What can you tell me about the merchants?
What can you tell me about the mind flayers?
We asked Ginafae to return, but it seems she hasn't yet.  She seemed wary of your men.
We found Ginafae, Malavon.  Unfortunately, we had to destroy her.
Farewell, Malavon.
We asked Ginafae to return, but it seems she hasn't yet.  She seemed wary of your men.
We found Ginafae, Malavon.  Unfortunately, we had to destroy her.
What can you tell me about this area?
Let me see what magical items you have for sale.
Farewell, Malavon.
What can you tell me about the mind flayers?
We asked Ginafae to return, but it seems she hasn't yet.  She seemed wary of your men.
We found Ginafae, Malavon.  Unfortunately, we had to destroy her.
Let me see what magical items you have for sale.
Farewell, Malavon.
What can you tell me about the merchants?
We asked Ginafae to return, but it seems she hasn't yet.  She seemed wary of your men.
We found Ginafae, Malavon.  Unfortunately, we had to destroy her.
Let me see what magical items you have for sale.
Farewell, Malavon.
We wanted to tell you about the progress we have made with the driders.
What can you tell me about this area?
Let me see what magical items you have for sale.
Farewell, Malavon.
We'll talk after I take care of the monsters I led here.
